title: Body Change
author: Elaine Taylor
excerpt: Having a double mastectomy is a journey that reshapes you in ways far beyond the physical—it is an act of courage wrapped in grief, hope, fear, and fierce love for life.
body:
Having a double mastectomy is a journey that reshapes you in ways far beyond the physical—it is an act of courage wrapped in grief, hope, fear, and fierce love for life. It means saying goodbye to a part of your body that may have held identity, femininity, or deeply personal memories, while choosing survival even when that choice feels impossibly heavy.

There is a quiet mourning in the scars, moments of looking in the mirror and learning a new version of yourself, but within those same marks lives undeniable strength.

Each scar becomes proof of endurance, of nights survived, tears shed, and battles fought in silence.

It is a process of learning that your worth, beauty, and wholeness were never confined to what was taken away.

Through the pain, vulnerability, and rebuilding, a deeper self emerges—one rooted in resilience, gratitude, and an unshakable will to keep living, loving, and moving forward, even when the path ahead feels uncertain.
